body:
https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/6821/im-a-member-and-im-not

Here's a post where someone seemed to be confused by this feature. I think that a private guild should have 2 subscriber counts, one with the total subscriber count, and one with the number of approved contributors who are subscribed.

The total subscriber count can be called "Members", while the subscriber count that only includes approved contributors can be called "Approved Members". The number of approved members can be displayed to the right of the total member count.
body_html:
https://ruqqus.com/+Ruqqus/post/6821/im-a-member-and-im-not

Here's a post where someone seemed to be confused by this feature. I think that a private guild should have 2 subscriber counts, one with the total subscriber count, and one with the number of approved contributors who are subscribed.

The total subscriber count can be called "Members", while the subscriber count that only includes approved contributors can be called "Approved Members". The number of approved members can be displayed to the right of the total member count.

guild.description:
This used to be a place to share, view, and track feedback for Ruqqus. Now it's pretty useless because the admins don't care. Try buttering them up on discord. They don't respond here. 

+ruqqusbugs
guild.description_html:
This used to be a place to share, view, and track feedback for Ruqqus. Now it's pretty useless because the admins don't care. Try buttering them up on discord. They don't respond here.

+RuqqusBugs
guild.name: BetaFeedback

title: The subscriber count of a private guild only includes approved contributors. Because this is confusing, I believe that private guilds should have 2 separate subscriber counts: one that includes all subscribers, and one that only includes subscribers who are approved contributors
